  • django.db.backends.ddl_references
  • View page source

django.db.backends.ddl_references

Helpers to manipulate deferred DDL statements that might need to be adjusted or discarded within when executing a migration.

Classes

Reference

Base class that defines the reference interface.

Table

Hold a reference to a table.

TableColumns

Base class for references to multiple columns of a table.

Columns

Hold a reference to one or many columns.

IndexName

Hold a reference to an index name.

IndexColumns

Hold a reference to one or many columns.

ForeignKeyName

Hold a reference to a foreign key name.

Statement

Statement template and formatting parameters container.

Expressions

Base class for references to multiple columns of a table.

Module Contents

class django.db.backends.ddl_references.Reference[source]

Base class that defines the reference interface.

references_table(table)[source]

Return whether or not this instance references the specified table.

references_column(table, column)[source]

Return whether or not this instance references the specified column.

rename_table_references(old_table, new_table)[source]

Rename all references to the old_name to the new_table.

rename_column_references(table, old_column, new_column)[source]

Rename all references to the old_column to the new_column.

class django.db.backends.ddl_references.Statement(template, **parts)[source]

Bases: Reference

Statement template and formatting parameters container.

Allows keeping a reference to a statement without interpolating identifiers that might have to be adjusted if they’re referencing a table or column that is removed
